channel.title: #iHunt: Gauntlet TGIT (March)
channel.description:
![ihuntlogo|690x201](upload://7S8CfS5y7sEFAg7b0rseNqIBsqZ.jpeg) ***Note: for the first 24 hours (10PM Eastern 1/17), please only sign up if you have not yet played in a game I’ve run***
This is for four sessions of *#iHunt* , a game about monster-hunting in the gig economy. Being able to attend each session is encouraged, but not required. #iHunt uses a modified version of the Fate rules. Rules will be taught and in the first session we will establish tone, set boundaries, discuss out campaign frame, and create characters.
*Content Warning: This game leans into questions of poverty, survival, and desperate circumstances. These elements will likely overhang everything.*
**About #iHunt**
Be a hero. You pick the hours.
#iHunt is a story telling game about killing monsters in the gig economy. In it, you play millennials scraping by paycheck to paycheck to make ends meet. A gig app called #iHunt offers them more money than they've ever made to hit the streets and kill vampires, werewolves, demons, and anything else that goes bump in the night.
* #iHunt uses a modified version of the [Fate Core Rulebook](https://www.evilhat.com/home/fate-core-downloads/). * It's a high-drama, story-heavy urban fantasy roleplaying game. * It takes a critical look at the gig economy with irreverent humor.
We will be using Zoom for our sessions. I’ll email all players about a week before the first session with the necessary links. Sessions will run up to three hours. We will plan to record, but I will confirm this with the players. [The Gauntlet Code of Conduct](https://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/the-inclusivity-policy.html) will be in play and we will use Lines and Veils and the [X-Card](http://tinyurl.com/x-card-rpg) for safety tools.
If you sign up and your availability changes, please remember to drop from the site and give me a heads up.
